tasks.task: Construct and install a microinverter solar panel system on a roof.
subtasks: Assemble system components including solar panels, microinverters, performance meter, AC disconnect, and combiner.
Measure roof layout to ensure proper orientation and spacing for optimal solar panel placement.
Install mounting rails and fasteners for solar panels, ensuring a secure and stable setup.
Connect solar panels to microinverters using daisy chain wiring for maximum efficiency, bypassing traditional central inverters.
Route AC daisy chain wires through conduits and junction boxes to properly connect to the combiner and AC disconnect.
Monitor system performance using the performance meter and make adjustments for optimal energy output.
Ensure all electrical connections are safely capped and insulated to prevent shock hazards.
Verify proper operation of the system by closing AC disconnect and combiner box, and observing power generation.

tasks.task: Install and configure system for optimal solar power generation.
subtasks: Plan solar panel placement considering roof structure and shading to maximize sun exposure.
Cut and lay out mounting rails, ensuring correct spacing to accommodate the number of panels and their orientation.
Align and attach solar panels to rails using fasteners, ensuring correct polarity for the microinverters.
Connect microinverters to solar panels and to each other in the specified daisy chain configuration.
Connect the entire system to the combiner box and AC disconnect, verifying proper wiring and connections.
Test and calibrate the performance meter to track energy production and catch any errors or inefficiencies.

tasks.task: Ensure safe and legal installation of the solar power system.
subtasks: Follow all local electrical codes and zoning regulations when installing the solar system.
Verify compliance with utility company requirements, including installation of a performance meter and AC disconnect.
Document the installation process for potential future updates or maintenance.

tasks.task: Operate and maintain the solar power system.
subtasks: Regularly check connections and wiring for any signs of wear or damage.
Clean solar panels periodically to maintain maximum efficiency.
Monitor system performance and make necessary adjustments as energy needs or roof conditions change.

tasks.task: - **MAINTASK**
subtasks: Purchase and prepare all necessary components (e.g., solar panels, microinverters, performance meter, AC disconnect, ductwork, and conduits).
Ensure tools are available for assembly (e.g., drill, measuring tools, hammer, etc.).

tasks.task: Properly prepare the roof for solar panel installation.
subtasks: Conduct thorough roof inspection to assess structural integrity and identify any necessary repairs.
Gather and organize roofing materials for safe work practices.

tasks.task: Install solar panels following best practices.
subtasks: Measure and mark the roof for panel placement.
Assemble and attach mounting structures securely.
Carefully position and affix solar panels, ensuring correct orientation for maximum sun exposure.

tasks.task: Connect electrical components for the solar system.
subtasks: Wire microinverters to solar panels in a daisy chain configuration, adhering to safety and efficiency standards.
Route AC wiring through conduits and junction boxes, ensuring proper connections and insulation.

tasks.task: Assemble the system, connect to the AC disconnect and performance meter, and test operation.
subtasks: Install and configure the performance meter for tracking energy production.
Close electrical connections and verify system functionality.

tasks.task: Adhere to safety and legal requirements.
subtasks: Follow all local electrical codes and zoning regulations.
Ensure compliance with utility company requirements and obtain necessary permits.

subtasks: using tools and mounting structures)
working with wires, sockets)
checking meters, ensuring all components function)
